meanings.sent1: The tired puppy looked dowf as it lay in the shade.
meanings.sent2: She felt dowf about going to the party after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: The dowf cat refused to play with the yarn ball, preferring to nap instead.
meanings.sent4: His dowf mood cast a shadow over the cheerful gathering.
meanings.sent5: The gray clouds matched her dowf feelings perfectly.

meanings.definition: To make or become dull or inactive
meanings.sent1: The rain dowfed the once vibrant colors of the painting.
meanings.sent2: He didn't want to dowf the excitement of the game with his negative comments.
meanings.sent3: The magician dowfed the audience's interest by performing the same trick repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous lecture dowfed the students' enthusiasm for the subject.
meanings.sent5: The long winter nights dowf the spirits of the townspeople.
